Pre-Game Insights: Wales are in a new era after the retirement of star player Gareth Bale.
The first round of the UEFA Nations League 2024-25 will include the Dragons hosting Turkey at Cardiff City Stadium.
Turkey will start as slight favourites despite being the away team but the Welsh threat cannot be overlooked.
Wales as the home team will surely try to put pressure on the opposition team and will look to get a good advantage on Turkey but most probably Turkey will win this fixture.
Wales will be desperate to make an early statement here.
Turkey will look to finish the group at the top.
Wales will look to get a win to boost their confidence for sure.
Both sides will be looking to give each other a tough challenge on the pitch, fans can expect an intense match and both teams will look to get the win to get that confidence boost.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The average number of goals in meetings between Wales and Turkey is 1.6
Their last meeting was a draw.
The Dragons score 0.8 goals in a match against Turkey and Turkey score 0.8 goals against Wales (on average).
Daniel James will not be available for the match as he left the team camp due to a hamstring injury.
Turkey doesn’t have any injury issues and will have a fully fit squad available for the match.
Wales Predicted Lineup (3-4-2-1): Ward(GK); Rodon, Cabango, Davies; Roberts, James, Ampadu, Williams; Wilson, Johnson; Matondo
Turkey Predicted Lineup (5-4-1): Gunok(GK); Muldur, Ayhan, Akaydin, Demiral, Kadioglu; Guler, Ozcan, Calhanoglu, Yildiz; Yilmaz
